body.para: Sorry again, maybe I just misunderstand You. You write in first post in this thread:

quote.quotepara:
I just composed a message that contained pasted text, numbered paras and
bulleted paras. Tbird used different font sizes for the numbered and bulleted
paras (why, when I did not ask it to?) and I changed them and the pasted text
until they all looked the same size on the screen

body.para: There is something about pasting, so I assume You pasted text with formatting, and this formatting interact somehow with other text You edited manually. But I may be wrong.

I personally fix some bugs in Composer, by using my "Stationery" extension. I just have several templates, with good amount of CSS rules inside. This rules override some TB defaults, for example by forcing base font size and face. I also fix lists formatting (half-line of empty space between list elements greatly increase readability), paragraph formatting (first line indenting), etc.
In practice, it is enough for all my business mails. Sometimes I need more than Composer controls allow me. In this cases I use HTML source editor, and I do required fixes there.
Currently I try to enhance Composer formatting abilities, according to my and other "Stationery" users needs.
Now I try to implement free font size selection (in print points), and to allow to highlight some parts of text (change background color for part of text instead of for whole page).
